data.title: Player pause/resume, FPS counter, Q/E swap, directory asset reimport
data.body:
Added Pause/Resume/Frame step of running player using IPC events
Added FPS counter to debug hud
Swapped Q/E shortcuts to be consistent with modelling software conventions
Added forced asset reimport context menu item for directories

data.title: Add confirmation dialog to Developer/Clear Preferences
data.body: Inform the user that preferences will be deleted and the editor will exit and reset to its default state

data.title: Update default camera on new project templates
data.body:
- 3D - The Basic3D example has been updated, this just needs to be copied over to the Project3D template in the AtomicGameEngine repository
- 2D - Add a sprite to the center of the scene with a spinner component (instead of instantiating in script), this should be done in the AtomicExamples repository first (https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples/tree/master/Basic2D) and then update the Project2D template

The project templates are located here: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/tree/master/Data/AtomicEditor/ProjectTemplates

data.title: Add getting started to help menu
tweak the CEF resources files copy bit
data.body: Trying to remove some noise from the log. CEF was complaining about missing files. This change will pick them up.

data.title: Problems to build an Android Application
data.body:
When I download the first time the Atomic Engine, I opened an example 2D and tried to build for Android devices.

The error that happen was:

can't open my Android-Build/res/values/strings.xml 

The solution was:

1 - Enter in the /Applications/AtomicEditor.app/Contents/Resources/ToolData/Deployment/Android/res/values

2 - Create a xml file called strings.xml with the content above:

`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<resources>
    <string name="app_name">Atomic</string>
</resources>
`

Be happy.

I did all that in my MacOs, but if you have the same problem using Linux or Windows, I think it can help you too.

if for any reason your application doesn't have one of that directories, you can create it.

data.title: Add method to easily take screenshots from the Atomic Editor
data.body: This might be a key combo, or possibly a menu item that has a short delay (to not capture UI), also we need a preference dialog to save where screenshots are stored

data.title: Support for external BSP/CSG based level creation tools
data.body:
So there are allot of level creation tools out there for Quake. Most of which are free, open source and/or are cross platform. All of them support the .map format.

Opposed to writing a custom BSP/CSG tool for the atomic game engine why not create a importer for .map format levels for atomic game engine?

What are the benefits?
1. Level Designers and artists can create levels quickly with out a 3D modeling application and get them inside atomic quickly and easily.
2. Time saved by using existing tools and battle tested technology used to ship games that is already open source.
3. The format is well documented and can be easily implemented [link](http://www.gamers.org/dEngine/quake/QDP/qmapspec.html)
4. We get a bunch of robust level editing toolsets for free that people are already familiar with.

**So what should this "Importer" do?**
1. Import level geometry / Brushes from the .map file
2. Preserve UV Coordinates and texture placement within the map.
3. Import the textures that are in use inside the .map file
4. It should remove faces with "no draw" on them. (Optimization)

**What should the "Importer" _NOT_ do?**
1. Import game play specific entities (These can be defined in the atomic game editor)
2. Import game play specific volumes (These can be defined in the atomic game editor)

To finish this feature request off I am posting an image of something that I am made with the Hammer Level Editor. I am a novice level designer an I made a some what good looking replica of the Lincoln Memorial as a test for this feature request. I have used hammer once or twice in the past and I am no pro with it. But this should show you how beneficial such tools can be.

![Image](http://i.imgur.com/1Pqw88I.png)

data.title: [LINUX] Segmentation fault when running some of the sample projects
data.body:
Opening Basic2D and BunnyMark example projects works fine, but they crash on play with "Segmentation fault (core dumped)". Before the crash I'm able to see some moving graphics for half a second.

Running Arch Linux. Example projects cloned from https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicExamples

data.title: chnages to LinuxBuild.js
data.body: copy over CEF support files to AtomicEditor directory

data.title: [ANDROID] - 64 bit NDK make path
data.body:
The 64 bit ndk has a different make path than is being used by the build scripts: 

prebuilt/windows/bin/make.exe  vs prebuilt/windows-x86_64/bin/make.exe

The build scripts need to detect this and use the proper make path

data.title: Atomic Game Engine MIT License
Issue #587 : Improve JSBProperty::GetCasePropertyName case generation
data.body:
. Currently transforms property names in required format URLEnabled -> urlEnabled, thus  for

eg:     URLEnabled -> urlEnabled
        BaseType -> baseType
        Type -> type
        RGBA16Format -> rgba16Format

Issue #571 - Ensure the editor's player log window is able to handle multiline print/console.log from player process.

data.title: Issue #437: Can't add a class without a default public constructor to JSBind
Issue #577: Added "Clear Preferences" to developer menu. Also added I
data.body: F-statement to be used by the clear prefences option. Sets all values in prefs.json to default values, clears recent project list and shuts down the editor.

data.title: Issue #576 User can no longer enter exclusive fullscreen mode during
data.body: Editor mode, but can enter fullscreen when in Play Mode.

data.title: Flip Normal when scaling

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
Scaling a mesh in the negative value inverses the normals. (see pic)
![normalscaleissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11769017/13804614/27b32e7c-eb57-11e5-89c3-d0a349d0585a.jpg)

data.title: Camera Movement in Viewport
data.body: Up and Down are reverse, Up should be E and Down should be Q.

data.title: Editor functionality - Selection
data.body:
When we select a value "box" (where we can changed the rotation of an object for example). If we want to enter a new value we have to select the current value then enter the new value, so if I want to set an object to the coordinate 0,0,0, I have to select the X "box" then Crtl+A enter the new value, then tab to go to the other box and have to Crtl+A then enter the value.

Could it be changed by default to select the current value in order to change it directly.

data.title: Adding accessor for IPC other process, terminate for Windows
Don't require CoreData for headless builds
New code editor: several Edit menu options are not working (see note)
data.body:
The following Edit menu options do not work on Windows/OSX:
cut, copy, paste, select all, undo, redo

Note: the hotkeys work
